item.title: Today’s Wordle #1686: Hints and Answer for January 30, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1686 for January 30, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, January 30, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1686 is a lot tougher than the last. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 5.5 of 6 guesses. That makes it harder than the 3.8-guess average from January 29.

General Wordle Hints For January 30

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is most often used as a modifier, not a standalone noun.
  • Hint 2: It’s commonly associated with size or scale.
  • Hint 3: You’ll frequently see it paired with everyday objects.
  • Hint 4: The word has a slightly playful or informal tone.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1686 for January 30, 2026.

Starter Words For January 30, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • MOUND
  • BUMPS
  • JUMPS
  • JELLY

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1686 On January 30, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: JUMBO

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

JUMBO is a noun that means “a very large person, animal, or thing.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1685 on January 29, 2026

Answer: FLAKY

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #16865?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on January 31 will be Wordle Game #1687.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: Black Ops 7 Season 2 Brings 9 Multiplayer Maps
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty has announced its season 2 content for Black Ops 7, including the launch of several new multiplayer maps and a handful of returning ones, with the season’s start on February 5.

Multiplayer content is a central focal point of the second season of Black Ops 7. In addition to several new modes arriving throughout the season, ranked play is returning, along with other multiplayer events. Nine multiplayer maps are included. Included among them are a couple of remastered maps and a couple of returning maps from Black Ops 6.

Remastered and Returning Maps Are Built for 6v6 Play

Cliff Town is a remaster of the Yemen map from Call of Duty: Black Ops 2. The Call of Duty team describes this as a tightly packed map with a good blend of narrow alleys and elevated Vantage points. It is a medium-sized map scheduled for release mid-season.

Additionally, Slums is another remastered medium-sized map from the second Black Ops game. This map will be available at launch. It’s dubbed one of the most iconic Maps in the Black Ops series, offering a true test of skill for both casual and competitive players.

There are also a couple of returning maps from Black Ops 6, including Firing Range and Grind. Both are medium-sized and scheduled for mid-season release.

Five New Maps Are on the Way to Black Ops 7

In addition to the returning maps, there’s a handful of new maps on the way. Some of which will even be available at the launch of the second season.

Torment, Sake, and Nexus will be available on launch. Torment and Sake are exclusively built for 6v6 gameplay. Nexus, however, is also compatible with 2v2 matches as it is a small-sized map.

There’s also a new map called Torque. It is a small map built for 6v6 gameplay and recalls the Battle of Los Angeles from Black Ops 2.

Lastly, there’s a brand-new skirmish map built for 20v20 gameplay. Named “Peak,” the map is built for large-scale confrontations. It features narrow medieval streets, High Value Sectors to claim, sniper rooftops, a central snaking road, a waterlogged perimeter with Tactical Rafts, a harbor, fishery warehouses, and intense house-to-house combat.

Which of these maps are you most excited for? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fallout Season 1 Episodes Available for Free on YouTube
item.content:encoded:
Amazon Prime Video is releasing all of Fallout’s Season 1 episodes on its official YouTube channel for free.

Fallout Season 2 is already coming to a close, with episode 8 set to release this week; check out Insider Gaming’s guide for the latest release date and start times. As we wait for the season finale, Prime Video is giving away freebies to build hype for the upcoming episode.

Fallout Season 1, Episodes 1 and 2, Are Already Out on YouTube

If you head over to the official Prime Video YouTube channel, you will see that there is a brand new category called Fallout Season 1 Full Episodes. They uploaded episode 1, “The End,” and episode 2, “The Target,” yesterday, with more to follow as we approach the Season 2 finale release date. Check out the release schedule for all Fallout Season 1 Episodes on YouTube below:

Fallout Season 1 Episode Release Schedule for YouTube

  • Season 1 Episode 1 “The End” – January 28, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 2 “The Target” – January 28, 6 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 3 “The Head” – January 29, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 4 “The Ghouls” – January 29, 6 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 5 “The Past” – January 30, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 6 “The Trap” – January 30, 6 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 7 “The Radio” – January 31, 5 PM PT
  • Season 1 Episode 8 “The Beginning” – January 31, 6 PM PT

In other news, the creators of the beloved Fallout mod are not interested in remaster projects. Fallout 3 and New Vegas remakes are not releasing anytime soon, according to a new claim. What are your thoughts on Fallout Season 1 episodes becoming available for free on YouTube? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Nintendo’s response to “leaked” Nintendo Switch Online GameCube games. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
